intro: Thryptomene hexamera, commonly known as the broad-leaf thryptomene, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Thryptomene hexamera is often found in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
